question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Dependency chain caching] When a module and its dependencies are verified together, are all their hashes cached atomically, or can partial caching leave the cache in an inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Module deletion] If a module is deleted from storage but its hash remains cached, can contains() incorrectly indicate the module is verified when it no longer exists? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: flush()] [Upgrade coordination] During module upgrades, if flush() is not called to invalidate old module caches, can old and new module versions coexist in the cache causing verification confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Block-STM coordination] During parallel transaction execution with Block-STM, can speculative execution paths cache module hashes that are later aborted, leaving incorrect verification state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Transaction abort caching] If a transaction verifies and caches a module hash via put() but then aborts due to validation failure, does the cached hash persist causing the aborted module to appear verified? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Static: VERIFIED_MODULES_CACHE] [Parallel cache coherence] With Block-STM's optimistic concurrency, can parallel transactions see inconsistent cache states due to concurrent modifications, causing non-deterministic verification behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Execution re-validation] When Block-STM re-executes transactions after conflicts, does contains() return consistent results on re-execution, or can cache state changes between executions cause different verification paths? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Speculative caching] Can speculative execution paths add hashes to the cache prematurely before transaction commit, polluting the cache with modules from transactions that may abort? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Gas inconsistency] Does cache hit vs miss affect transaction gas consumption (since verification is skipped), and can this cause gas metering inconsistencies across validators with different cache states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Verification gas] Is gas charged for module verification before caching, and can attackers exploit cached modules to avoid verification gas costs on subsequent loads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Cache operation cost] Are contains() and put() operations free from a gas perspective, allowing unlimited cache queries and insertions that could be exploited for DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: flush()] [Flush performance impact] When flush() is called during block execution (e.g., triggered by governance), does it cause a performance spike that could affect block time and validator participation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Constant: VERIFIED_CACHE_SIZE] [Cache size tuning] Is the 100,000 entry cache size optimal for gas economics, or can attackers exploit cache misses to force expensive verification that consumes excessive gas? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Hash algorithm change] If the underlying hash algorithm changes from SHA3-256 to a different algorithm, are existing cached hashes invalidated, or can mismatched hash algorithms cause verification bypass? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Hash encoding] Is the 32-byte hash stored in consistent byte order (big-endian vs little-endian), or can endianness issues cause hash mismatches across different architectures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Hash comparison] Does contains() use constant-time comparison for the 32-byte hash arrays to prevent timing side channels, or can variable-time comparison leak information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Hash truncation] If module hashes are ever truncated or padded (e.g., for storage efficiency), can this introduce collision vulnerabilities or cache mismatches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Struct: VerifiedModuleCache] [Hash randomization] Does the LRU cache use hash randomization for the internal HashMap (if any), or can hash collision DoS attacks against the cache data structure affect performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Empty hash handling] Can contains() be called with an all-zeros hash [0u8; 32], and does it handle this edge case correctly without false positives? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Duplicate hash handling] If put() is called multiple times with the same hash, does it idempotently update the LRU queue without side effects or corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: size()] [Empty cache size] When the cache is empty (size() == 0), do contains() and other operations handle this edge case correctly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: flush()] [Double flush] Can flush() be called multiple times in succession, and does it handle already-empty cache gracefully without errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [LRU get() failure] If the internal LRU get() operation fails or returns None, is this handled correctly by contains() without panicking? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: contains()] [Verification config versioning] If the Move bytecode verifier has multiple configuration versions, does contains() check that cached modules were verified under the current config version, preventing config mismatch attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/verified_module_cache.rs] [Function: put()] [Native function changes] When native function implementations are updated, are cached module verifications invalidated, or can modules with outdated native function assumptions remain cached?
